DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Surgery Unresected Brain Metastasis Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to radiation surgery being administered to the unresected (cancer that has not been either partly or completely removed by surgery) brain cancer that spread from the organ in which it first appeared.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Surgery Unresected Brain Metastasis Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation surgery being administered to the unresected (cancer that has not been either partly or completely removed by surgery) brain cancer that spread from the organ in which it first appeared.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique that delivers radiation directly to the tumor while sparing the healthy tissue. Also called radiation surgery and stereotactic external beam irradiation.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to treat cancer cells that use high energy beams.

Property.preferredDefinition: Describes an organ, tissue, or cancer that has not been either partly or completely removed by surgery.:An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Describes an organ, tissue, or cancer that has not been either partly or completely removed by surgery.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
